First batch of DPRK sports delegates to Asiad leaves
articles.content:
First batch of DPRK sports delegates to Asiad leaves
    Pyongyang, September 23 (KCNA) -- The first batch of DPRK sports delegates left here today to participate in the 14th Asian Games to be held in Pusan.
 Sportspersons of the north will participate in international games to be held in South Korea for the first time in the history of national split. This would mark a significant opportunity in achieving the reconciliation and unity between the north and the south and bringing earlier the day of the reunification of the country.    
 They were seen off at the airport by secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea Central Committee Kim Jung Rin, vice-premier of the cabinet Kwak Pom Gi, first secretary of the central committee of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League Kim Kyong Ho, chairman of the Pyongyang City People's Committee Ryang Man Gil, officials concerned, sportspersons and working people in the city.

articles.title: Russian artistes here
articles.content:
Russian artistes here
    Pyongyang, September 23 (KCNA) --The state academy ensemble of the Ministry of Interior of Russia led by its head V. P. Eliseyev arrived here today.
 It was met at the airport by officials concerned and the Russian Ambassador to the DPRK.

articles.title: Greetings to President of Guinea-Bissau
articles.content:
Greetings to President of Guinea-Bissau
    Pyongyang, September 23 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, on Sept. 19 sent a message of greetings to Kumba Ialla, President of Guinea-Bissau, on the occasion of the 29th anniversary of the proclamation of its Republic.
 Kim Yong Nam wished the president and people of Guinea-Bissau greater success in the work for national unity and the economic development of the country and expressed belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger.

articles.title: Greetings to President of Mali
articles.content:
Greetings to President of Mali
    Pyongyang, September 23 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, on Sept. 19 sent a message of greetings to Amadou Toumani Toure, President of Mali, on the occasion of the 42nd anniversary of the proclamation of its Republic.
 Kim Yong Nam sincerely wished the president new success in his responsible work for the development of the country and expressed belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger in the interests of the two peoples.

articles.title: Basic agreement on dev. and man. of Sinuiju Spe. Administrative Region signed
articles.content:
Basic agreement on dev. and man. of Sinuiju Spe. Administrative Region signed
    Pyongyang, September 23 (KCNA) -- A basic agreement on development and management of the Sinuiju Special Administrative Region was signed here today between the DPRK Committee for Promotion of External Economic Cooperation and the Holland Euro-Asia International Import and Export Trade Company.
 Present at the signing ceremony were chairman of the committee Kim Yong Sul, vice-chairman of the State Planning Commission Jo Yong Nam, chairman of the North Phyongan Provincial People's Committee Pak Kyong Sam and other officials concerned and president of the company Bin Yang and his party.    
 The agreement was inked by Kim Yong Sul and Bin Yang.
